alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 7:34AM CDT until July 19 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Cheatham, Davidson, Dickson, Hickman, Humphreys, Maury and Williamson. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 731 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area, especially with additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches this morning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hurricane Creek including Hurricane Mills, West Piney River including Eno, Garners Creek including Oak Grove, East Piney River including areas near Dickson, Murfrees Fork including Thompsons Station, and Sycamore Creek including Burwood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Columbia, Dickson, Waverly, Centerville, Camden, Brentwood, Spring Hill, White Bluff, Kingston Springs, Thompson`s Station, Pegram, New Johnsonville, McEwen, Burns, Fairview, Hurricane Mills, Bon Aqua, Lyles and Primm Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
